metadata.description: Synthetic Jira and Slack dataset demonstrating the introduction of Qdrant hybrid query score boosting, including historical motivation and team discussion.

jira_tickets.title: Client-Side Reranking Causes Latency Spikes on Large Result Sets
jira_tickets.description: When hybrid search returns >50 results, client-side reranking adds 200-400ms of latency. Users on the free tier are reporting timeouts. We need server-side score control to eliminate this bottleneck.
acceptance_criteria: Identify root cause of latency in reranking pipeline
Propose server-side alternative to client reranking
Benchmark latency improvement with proposed fix

jira_tickets.title: Implement Hybrid Query Score Boosting
jira_tickets.description: Add support for query-time score boosting in Qdrant hybrid queries to allow fine-grained control over how dense (vector) and sparse (keyword) signals are combined. This removes the need for client-side reranking and enables more intuitive relevance tuning.
acceptance_criteria: Support configurable weights for dense vs sparse queries
Allow per-field score boosting in sparse/text queries
Ensure boosted scores influence final ranking deterministically
Add unit tests covering boosted and non-boosted scenarios

jira_tickets.title: Add Documentation and Examples for Hybrid Score Boosting
jira_tickets.description: Document how score boosting works in Qdrant hybrid queries, including examples that clearly demonstrate how boosting affects ranking and relevance.
acceptance_criteria: Explain hybrid query scoring and fusion at a high level
Include Python and REST examples using score boosting
Provide before/after examples comparing boosted vs non-boosted results

jira_tickets.title: Demo UI: Visualize Hybrid Search Score Boosting
jira_tickets.description: Create a demo UI that visualizes how score boosting affects hybrid search results in real time, making relevance tuning intuitive for demos and presentations.
acceptance_criteria: Display dense score, sparse score, and final combined score
Allow live adjustment of boost weights
Visually reorder results as boosts change

jira_tickets.title: Boosted Scores Not Deterministic When Using RRF Fusion
jira_tickets.description: When using Reciprocal Rank Fusion with boosted prefetch queries, the final ranking occasionally differs between identical requests. Suspected race condition in score aggregation.
acceptance_criteria: Reproduce non-deterministic ranking with test case
Fix race condition in fusion score aggregation
Add regression test ensuring identical queries return identical rankings

messages.message: Looked into JIRA-998 — the reranking latency is brutal on large result sets. We're pulling 100 docs, computing custom scores in Python, then re-sorting. This should be happening server-side in Qdrant.

We've had 3 enterprise customers ask for this in the last month. They want to weight title matches higher than body matches, but right now there's no clean way to do that without the client-side hack.
Kicking off work on hybrid query score boosting. This lets us control dense vs sparse influence directly in Qdrant instead of hacking relevance client-side.
This came up a lot in user feedback. People liked hybrid search, but wanted something closer to classic search engines where some fields clearly matter more.
Historically Qdrant fused dense and sparse signals evenly, but there wasn't a clean way to boost titles, keywords, or semantic similarity without extra reranking logic. That changes now.
Ran early tests on boosted hybrid queries. Changing weights clearly shifts rankings, and results feel way more intuitive now. Latency dropped from ~350ms to ~40ms by removing client reranking.
This is going to be great for demos. Showing the same query with and without boosting instantly explains why certain results move up.
Found a non-determinism issue with RRF fusion + boosting — filed JIRA-1004. Same query sometimes returns slightly different orderings. Might be a race condition.
For the demo narrative, we should highlight that score boosting came directly from OSS feedback — users wanted hybrid search, but also control and predictability.
